choices.text: Little penguin Polo likes permutations. But most of all he likes permutations of integers from 0 to n, inclusive. For permutation p = p_0, p_1, ..., p_{n}, Polo has defined its beauty number $(0 \oplus p_{0}) +(1 \oplus p_{1}) + \cdots +(n \oplus p_{n})$. Expression $x \oplus y$ means applying the operation of bitwise excluding "OR" to numbers x and y. This operation exists in all modern programming languages, for example, in language C++ and Java it is represented as "^" and in Pascal as "xor". Help him find among all permutations of integers from 0 to n the permutation with the maximum beauty.
